metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: 【速報中】ミラノ・コルティナ五輪 開会式 日本選手団も行進
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピックの開会式が行われています。「広域開催」となる今大会の開会式は、4つの会場で同時に行われ、聖火台も、ミラノとコルティナの2か所に設置されて、同時に点灯される予定です。日本の選手団はスピードスケートの森重航選手とスノーボードの冨田せな選手が旗手を務めました。最新情報をお伝えしています。

all.headline: 日本海側中心に9日にかけ雪強まる 東京23区なども積もるおそれ
all.description: 冬型の気圧配置の影響で、9日の月曜日にかけて日本海側を中心に雪が強まり、東京23区をはじめ関東など太平洋側の平地でも積もるおそれがあります。気象庁は大雪による交通への影響などに十分注意するよう呼びかけています。

all.headline: NYダウ 終値で初の5万ドル突破 米景気先行きに楽観的見方で
all.description: 6日のニューヨーク株式市場のダウ平均株価は前日から1200ドル余り値上がりし、終値としても初めて5万ドルの大台に乗せました。アメリカの景気の先行きに対する楽観的な見方が広がる中で買い注文が増え、株価を押し上げた形です。

all.headline: 衆議院選挙 きょう選挙戦最終日 各党の党首ら最後の訴え
all.description: 衆議院選挙は8日、投票日を迎えます。各党の党首らは選挙戦最終日の7日、接戦とみている選挙区や比例代表での得票の上積みを目指す地域に入って最後の訴えを行うことにしています。

all.headline: 米とイラン 核開発などで高官協議 イラン“協議継続で一致”
all.description: アメリカがイランへの軍事的な圧力を強める中、イランの核開発などをめぐる両国の高官による協議が、中東のオマーンで行われました。イラン側は「よいスタートだった」と評価し、協議を継続することで一致したと明らかにしました。

all.headline: 日米合意の80兆円規模の対米投資 3プロジェクトが第1弾候補に
all.description: 先の日米合意に基づくアメリカへの80兆円規模の投資で、ガス火力発電所の建設など3つのプロジェクトが第1弾の候補となっていることが、関係者への取材で分かりました。近く日米の閣僚が詰めの協議を行う見通しです。

all.headline: フィギュア団体 女子シングルSP 坂本花織トップ 日本2位浮上
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケート団体の予選3種目目、女子シングルのショートプログラムで、エースの坂本花織選手がシーズンベストの得点でトップに立ち、日本は予選の1種目を残して2位に浮上しました。

all.headline: Dance pair puts U.S. ahead of Japan in team figure skating as Sakamoto shines
all.description: Riku Miura and Ryuichi Kihara won the pairs short program to help keep Japan within striking distance.

all.headline: Smile Japan opens Olympic campaign with narrow win over France
all.description: Makoto Ito broke a 1-1 tie late in the third period and Japan held on to beat a game French squad.

all.headline: Against the grain: Japanese wine aged in local barrels
all.description: A small but growing number of domestic winemakers are using vessels made from native trees such as “mizunara,” moving away from the norm of using European or American oak.

all.headline: Vulnerability, love and the limits of reality TV on 'The Boyfriend'
all.description: Netflix Japan’s same-sex dating show may be several layers removed from reality, but it nonetheless offers an important space for dialogue and representation.

all.headline: Tokyo students learn importance of elections through comedy
all.description: For the past 10 years, comedian Nana Takamatsu has held classes at schools nationwide for a total of about 100,000 students.

all.headline: Toyota appoints CFO Kenta Kon as new CEO
all.description: Koji Sato, current president and CEO of the world’s largest car company, will step down effective April 1.

all.headline: Japan’s SkyDrive hopes to have flying cars in service by 2028
all.description: Regulatory approval from the Japanese government is key to achieving the company’s goal.

all.headline: LDP-JIP coalition set for commanding election victory, polls show
all.description: The ruling bloc could end up with more than 300 seats, giving it a possible two-thirds majority in the Lower House.

all.headline: Eileen Gu arrives at Winter Olympics with new sense of freedom
all.description: At the Beijing Games in 2022, Gu became the first person to win three freestyle skiing medals at a single Olympics.

all.headline: Ukrainian flag bearer at Olympics proud to display nation's resiliency
all.description: Heraskevych will march in Milan on Friday evening as his country's flag bearer, alongside speedskater Yelyzaveta Sydorko.

all.headline: Vietnam’s Cherry Blossom Doctor Turns 10 Seeds from Japan into 120,000 Trees, Creating Lakeside Attraction
all.description: DIEN BIEN PHU, Vietnam — In northwestern Vietnam, agricultural biologist Tran Le is known as the “cherry blossom doctor.” He has researched and cultivated Japanese cherry blossom trees, starting with

all.headline: JR Yamanote Line Suspends Service Due to Accident on Saikyo Line
all.description: JR Yamanote Line suspended its services on both the inner and outer loops as of 8 p.m. on Friday due to an accident on Saikyo Line, according to a JR East announcement.

all.headline: Galaxy Cluster Seen Forming Early in Universe’s History
all.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) — Observations by NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope and Chandra X-ray Observatory are providing fresh evidence that the universe grew up a lot more quickly than previously known,

all.headline: Social Media and Disinformation: Risks Becoming More Serious with Evolution of Generative AI
all.description: The spread of disinformation and misinformation regarding the upcoming House of Representatives election continues unabated on social media.

all.headline: Japan’s Ruling, Opposition Party Execs Make Final Push to Secure Votes Ahead of Sunday’s Election
all.description: Senior officials of the ruling and opposition parties scrambled across the country on Friday, seeking to expand support ahead of Sunday’s House of Representatives election.

all.headline: Heavy Snow Forecast on Lower House Election Day from Northern to Western Japan
all.description: Heavy snow is expected to peak on Sunday, the day of the House of Representatives election. The Japan Meteorological Agency is raising an alarm and calling for vigilance against concerns such as traff

all.headline: For Thailand's popular progressives, winning the vote is only the first hurdle
all.description: The country votes again this weekend after three years of political turmoil.

all.headline: We had sex in a Chinese hotel, then found we had been broadcast to thousands
all.description: A couple who stayed in Shenzhen discovered their intimate moments were filmed as spy-cam porn.

all.headline: Coin portrait of late Queen draws criticism in Australia
all.description: The Royal Australian Mint has defended the design of the coins, which mark 100 years since Queen Elizabeth II's birth.

all.headline: At least 18 die in 'rat-hole' mine blast in India
all.description: Rescue operations are on as more people are feared trapped inside the mine, police say.

all.headline: Trump endorses Japan's Takaichi ahead of snap election
all.description: It is rare for US presidents to publicly back candidates in foreign elections.

all.headline: Growing calls in India to restrict children's social media use
all.description: Some Indian states have said they are examining Australia's law curbing social media for children.

all.headline: US must be prudent when supplying arms to Taiwan, Xi tells Trump
all.description: Their call comes in the wake of a flurry of visits by Western leaders to China in recent months.

all.headline: US launches plan to tackle China's critical minerals dominance
all.description: The event was attended by representatives of more than 50 countries, the White House said.

all.headline: Rights groups say China detained two journalists over corruption report
all.description: Liu Hu and Wu Yingjiao have been reportedly detained after exposing corruption by a senior official in Sichuan.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

competitors.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
competitors.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

competitors.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

primary.headline: 【速報中】ミラノ・コルティナ五輪 開会式 日本選手団も行進
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピックの開会式が行われています。「広域開催」となる今大会の開会式は、4つの会場で同時に行われ、聖火台も、ミラノとコルティナの2か所に設置されて、同時に点灯される予定です。日本の選手団はスピードスケートの森重航選手とスノーボードの冨田せな選手が旗手を務めました。最新情報をお伝えしています。

primary.headline: 日本海側中心に9日にかけ雪強まる 東京23区なども積もるおそれ
primary.description: 冬型の気圧配置の影響で、9日の月曜日にかけて日本海側を中心に雪が強まり、東京23区をはじめ関東など太平洋側の平地でも積もるおそれがあります。気象庁は大雪による交通への影響などに十分注意するよう呼びかけています。

primary.headline: NYダウ 終値で初の5万ドル突破 米景気先行きに楽観的見方で
primary.description: 6日のニューヨーク株式市場のダウ平均株価は前日から1200ドル余り値上がりし、終値としても初めて5万ドルの大台に乗せました。アメリカの景気の先行きに対する楽観的な見方が広がる中で買い注文が増え、株価を押し上げた形です。

primary.headline: 衆議院選挙 きょう選挙戦最終日 各党の党首ら最後の訴え
primary.description: 衆議院選挙は8日、投票日を迎えます。各党の党首らは選挙戦最終日の7日、接戦とみている選挙区や比例代表での得票の上積みを目指す地域に入って最後の訴えを行うことにしています。

primary.headline: 米とイラン 核開発などで高官協議 イラン“協議継続で一致”
primary.description: アメリカがイランへの軍事的な圧力を強める中、イランの核開発などをめぐる両国の高官による協議が、中東のオマーンで行われました。イラン側は「よいスタートだった」と評価し、協議を継続することで一致したと明らかにしました。

primary.headline: 日米合意の80兆円規模の対米投資 3プロジェクトが第1弾候補に
primary.description: 先の日米合意に基づくアメリカへの80兆円規模の投資で、ガス火力発電所の建設など3つのプロジェクトが第1弾の候補となっていることが、関係者への取材で分かりました。近く日米の閣僚が詰めの協議を行う見通しです。

primary.headline: フィギュア団体 女子シングルSP 坂本花織トップ 日本2位浮上
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケート団体の予選3種目目、女子シングルのショートプログラムで、エースの坂本花織選手がシーズンベストの得点でトップに立ち、日本は予選の1種目を残して2位に浮上しました。

primary.headline: Dance pair puts U.S. ahead of Japan in team figure skating as Sakamoto shines
primary.description: Riku Miura and Ryuichi Kihara won the pairs short program to help keep Japan within striking distance.

primary.headline: Smile Japan opens Olympic campaign with narrow win over France
primary.description: Makoto Ito broke a 1-1 tie late in the third period and Japan held on to beat a game French squad.

primary.headline: Against the grain: Japanese wine aged in local barrels
primary.description: A small but growing number of domestic winemakers are using vessels made from native trees such as “mizunara,” moving away from the norm of using European or American oak.

primary.headline: Vulnerability, love and the limits of reality TV on 'The Boyfriend'
primary.description: Netflix Japan’s same-sex dating show may be several layers removed from reality, but it nonetheless offers an important space for dialogue and representation.

primary.headline: Tokyo students learn importance of elections through comedy
primary.description: For the past 10 years, comedian Nana Takamatsu has held classes at schools nationwide for a total of about 100,000 students.

primary.headline: Toyota appoints CFO Kenta Kon as new CEO
primary.description: Koji Sato, current president and CEO of the world’s largest car company, will step down effective April 1.

primary.headline: Japan’s SkyDrive hopes to have flying cars in service by 2028
primary.description: Regulatory approval from the Japanese government is key to achieving the company’s goal.

primary.headline: LDP-JIP coalition set for commanding election victory, polls show
primary.description: The ruling bloc could end up with more than 300 seats, giving it a possible two-thirds majority in the Lower House.

primary.headline: Eileen Gu arrives at Winter Olympics with new sense of freedom
primary.description: At the Beijing Games in 2022, Gu became the first person to win three freestyle skiing medals at a single Olympics.

primary.headline: Ukrainian flag bearer at Olympics proud to display nation's resiliency
primary.description: Heraskevych will march in Milan on Friday evening as his country's flag bearer, alongside speedskater Yelyzaveta Sydorko.

primary.headline: Vietnam’s Cherry Blossom Doctor Turns 10 Seeds from Japan into 120,000 Trees, Creating Lakeside Attraction
primary.description: DIEN BIEN PHU, Vietnam — In northwestern Vietnam, agricultural biologist Tran Le is known as the “cherry blossom doctor.” He has researched and cultivated Japanese cherry blossom trees, starting with

primary.headline: JR Yamanote Line Suspends Service Due to Accident on Saikyo Line
primary.description: JR Yamanote Line suspended its services on both the inner and outer loops as of 8 p.m. on Friday due to an accident on Saikyo Line, according to a JR East announcement.

primary.headline: Galaxy Cluster Seen Forming Early in Universe’s History
primary.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) — Observations by NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope and Chandra X-ray Observatory are providing fresh evidence that the universe grew up a lot more quickly than previously known,

primary.headline: Social Media and Disinformation: Risks Becoming More Serious with Evolution of Generative AI
primary.description: The spread of disinformation and misinformation regarding the upcoming House of Representatives election continues unabated on social media.

primary.headline: Japan’s Ruling, Opposition Party Execs Make Final Push to Secure Votes Ahead of Sunday’s Election
primary.description: Senior officials of the ruling and opposition parties scrambled across the country on Friday, seeking to expand support ahead of Sunday’s House of Representatives election.

screenshots.name: Takaichi Sanae
tweets:
With the support of Taku Eto, an official of the Liberal Democratic Party, we visited Shintomi-cho, Koyu-gun, Miyazaki Prefecture.
The support for Taku Eto from everyone in Miyazaki 2 Wards (Nobeoka City, Hyuga City, Saitoshi, Koyu District, Higashiusuki District, Nishiusuki District) will be the strength of me, Sanae Takaichi.
Please leave your vote for “Taku Eto”!

I visited Kitakami City, Iwate Prefecture, with the support of Takashi Fujiwara, an official of the Liberal Democratic Party.
The support for Takashi Fujiwara from everyone in Iwate's 3 wards (Hanamaki City, Kitakami City, Ichinoseki City, Oshu City, Waga District, Isawa District, and Nishiiwai District) will be the strength of me, Sanae Takaichi.
Please leave your vote for “Takashi Fujiwara”!

With the support of Kazuo Yana, who is officially recognized by the Liberal Democratic Party, I visited Nasu-Shiobara City, Tochigi Prefecture.
The support for Kazuo Yana from everyone in Tochigi's 3 wards (Otawara City, Yaita City, Nasu Shiobara City, Nasu Karasuyama City, Nasu District) will be my strength, Sanae Takaichi.
Please leave your vote for “Yana Kazuo”!

I visited Kagoshima City, Kagoshima Prefecture with the support of Takuma Miyaji, who is officially recognized by the Liberal Democratic Party.
The support for Takuma Miyaji from everyone in Kagoshima Ward 1 (part of Kagoshima City, Kagoshima District) will be my strength, Sanae Takaichi.
Please leave your vote for “Miyaji Takuma”!

We will continue to deliver countermeasures against high prices to Kagoshima Prefecture!

This morning, I met with C.C. Wei, chairman of Taiwanese semiconductor manufacturer TSMC, at the Prime Minister's Office.

At today's meeting, I received a very encouraging report from Chairman Wei.
It was announced that TSMC would change its plans for a second factory in Kumamoto to produce cutting-edge 3-nanometer logic semiconductors and increase the total amount of investment.
